content.text: A character, hired leader, or controlled monster uses the Hide activity to try to hide. To record a Hide activity, he records "H". When he does the Hide activity he rolls the dice and consults the Hide Table to find his result. Important: Once he hides successfully he remains hidden. He does not have to roll for any additional Hide phases he has recorded â€“ he automatically remains hidden.
A character's counter is placed tan side up when unhidden and green side up when hidden. A hired or controlled denizen's counter is placed light side up when unhidden and dark side up when hidden.

A character, hired leader, or controlled monster who hides successfully remains hidden until he starts his next turn, unless he is revealed by being blocked during Daylight, being targeted in combat, selecting a target in combat (note: see rule 10.A.2 Ambushes), flying, or voluntarily becoming unhidden. He can choose to stop hiding at any time.
Characters, hired leaders, and controlled monsters can continue to do activities while they are hidden. They remain hidden as they move, search, trade, hire, etc.
Underlings become unhidden at the beginning of the day and can hide only by following a guide who hides successfully.
